device.name: AT91SAM9G15
device.description: Atmel AT91SAM9G15 device: ARM926EJ Embedded Microprocessor Unit, 400MHz, LCD, Touchscreen, HS USB, LPDDR/DDR2/MLC NAND support, 217 Pins (refer to http://www.atmel.com/devices/SAM9G15.aspx for more)

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Enable

field.name: TDRE
field.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Enable

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Disable

field.name: TDRE
field.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Disable

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Mask

field.name: TDRE
field.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Mask

field.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Enable

field.name: TDRE
field.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Enable

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Disable

field.name: TDRE
field.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Disable

field.name: TDRE

enumeratedValue.name: INIT
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization CMD: 74 clock cycles for initialization sequence.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronized CMD: Wait for the end of the current data block transfer before sending the pending command.

enumeratedValue.name: CE_ATA
enumeratedValue.description: CE-ATA Completion Signal disable Command. The host cancels the ability for the device to return a command completion signal on the command line.

enumeratedValue.name: IT_CMD
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt command: Corresponds to the Interrupt Mode (CMD40).

enumeratedValue.name: IT_RESP
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt response: Corresponds to the Interrupt Mode (CMD40).

enumeratedValue.name: BOR
enumeratedValue.description: Boot Operation Request. Start a boot operation mode, the host processor can read boot data from the MMC device directly.

enumeratedValue.name: EBO
enumeratedValue.description: End Boot Operation. This command allows the host processor to terminate the boot operation mode.

field.name: MAXLAT
field.description: Max Latency for Command to Response

enumeratedValue.name: COMPLETION
enumeratedValue.description: This bit indicates that a completion signal is expected within a programmed amount of time (HSMCI_CSTOR).

field.name: BCNT
field.description: MMC/SDIO Block Count - SDIO Byte Count

enumeratedValue.name: MULTIPLE
enumeratedValue.description: MMC/SD CARD Multiple BlockFrom 1 to 65635: Value 0 corresponds to an infinite block transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BYTE
enumeratedValue.description: SDIO ByteFrom 1 to 512 bytes: Value 0 corresponds to a 512-byte transfer.Values from 0x200 to 0xFFFF are forbidden.

enumeratedValue.name: BLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: SDIO BlockFrom 1 to 511 blocks: Value 0 corresponds to an infinite block transfer.Values from 0x200 to 0xFFFF are forbidden.

field.name: DTIP
field.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Enable

field.name: SDIOIRQA
field.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A Interrupt Enable

field.name: SDIOWAIT
field.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Enable

field.name: RENDE
field.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: CSTOE
field.description: Completion Signal Timeout Error Interrupt Enable

field.name: BLKOVRE
field.description: DMA Block Overrun Error Interrupt Enable

field.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Disable

field.name: SDIOIRQA

field.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Disable

field.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Disable

field.name: CSTOE
field.description: Completion Signal Time out Error Interrupt Disable

field.name: BLKOVRE

field.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Mask

field.name: SDIOIRQA
field.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A Interrupt Mask

field.name: SDIOWAIT
field.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Mask

field.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Mask

field.name: BLKOVRE
field.description: DMA Block Overrun Error Interrupt Mask

field.name: ACKRCV
field.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Received Interrupt Mask

field.name: ACKRCVE
field.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Error Interrupt Mask

field.name: CHKSIZE
field.description: DMA Channel Read and Write Chunk Size

field.name: FERRCTRL
field.description: Flow Error flag reset control mode

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: No Write Protection Violation occurred since the last read of this register (WP_SR)

enumeratedValue.name: WRITE
enumeratedValue.description: Write Protection detected unauthorized attempt to write a control register had occurred (since the last read.)

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset had been performed while Write Protection was enabled (since the last read).

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: Both Write Protection violation and software reset with Write Protection enabled have occurred since the last read.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Data to Read or Data to Write

enumeratedValue.description: Receive Clock only during data transfers

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous, as soon as the receiver is enabled, and immediately after the end of transfer of the previous data.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOMATIC
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic Echo. Receiver input is connected to the TXD pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_LOOPBACK
enumeratedValue.description: Local Loopback. Transmitter output is connected to the Receiver Input.

enumeratedValue.name: REMOTE_LOOPBACK
enumeratedValue.description: Remote Loopback. RXD pin is internally connected to the TXD pin.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store one 32-bit data. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4, INCR8 and INCR16 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR4
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of four 32-bit data. An AHB INCR4 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR and INCR4 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR8
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of eight 32-bit data. An AHB INCR8 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4 and INCR8 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR16
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of sixteen 32-bit data. An AHB INCR16 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4, INCR8 and INCR16 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store one 32-bit data. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4, INCR8 and INCR16 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR4
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of four 32-bit data. An AHB INCR4 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR and INCR4 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR8
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of eight 32-bit data. An AHB INCR8 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4 and INCR8 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: AHB_INCR16
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Access is started as soon as there is enough space in the FIFO to store a total amount of sixteen 32-bit data. An AHB INCR16 Burst is preferred. SINGLE, INCR, INCR4, INCR8 and INCR16 bursts can be used. INCR is used for a burst of 2 and 3 beats.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal Mode: The macro is in Full Speed mode, ready to make a High Speed identification, if the host supports it and then to automatically switch to High Speed mode

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_SPEED
enumeratedValue.description: Force High Speed: Set this value to force the hardware to work in High Speed mode. Only for debug or test purpose.

enumeratedValue.name: FULL_SPEED
enumeratedValue.description: Force Full Speed: Set this value to force the hardware to work only in Full Speed mode. In this configuration, the macro will not respond to a High Speed reset handshake.
Zero bank, the endpoint is not mapped in memory

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal Mode: The ADC Core and reference voltage circuitry are kept ON between conversions

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEP
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep Mode: The ADC Core and reference voltage circuitry are OFF between conversions

enumeratedValue.name: OFF
enumeratedValue.description: Normal Sleep Mode: The sleep mode is defined by the SLEEP bit

enumeratedValue.name: ON
enumeratedValue.description: Fast Wake Up Sleep Mode: The Voltage reference is ON between conversions and ADC Core is OFF

enumeratedValue.name: NUM_ORDER
enumeratedValue.description: Normal Mode: The controller converts channels in a simple numeric order depending only on the channel index.

enumeratedValue.name: REG_ORDER
enumeratedValue.description: User Sequence Mode: The sequence respects what is defined in ADC_SEQR1 and ADC_SEQR2 registers and can be used to convert several times the same channel.

field.name: XRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure XPOS Ready Interrupt Enable

field.name: YRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure YPOS Ready Interrupt Enable

field.name: PRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure Pressure Ready Interrupt Enable

field.name: XRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure XPOS Ready Interrupt Disable

field.name: YRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure YPOS Ready Interrupt Disable

field.name: PRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure Pressure Ready Interrupt Disable

field.name: XRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure XPOS Ready Interrupt Mask

field.name: YRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure YPOS Ready Interrupt Mask

field.name: PRDY
field.description: Touchscreen Measure Pressure Ready Interrupt Mask

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Generates an event when the converted data is lower than the low threshold of the window.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Generates an event when the converted data is higher than the high threshold of the window.

enumeratedValue.name: IN
enumeratedValue.description: Generates an event when the converted data is in the comparison window.

enumeratedValue.name: OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Generates an event when the converted data is out of the comparison window.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FILTER
enumeratedValue.description: No Filtering. Only one ADC conversion per measure

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TRIGGER
enumeratedValue.description: No trigger, only software trigger can start conversions

enumeratedValue.name: PEN_TRIG
enumeratedValue.description: Pen Detect Trigger (shall be selected only if PENDET is set and TSAMOD = Touchscreen only mode)

enumeratedValue.name: PERIOD_TRIG
enumeratedValue.description: Periodic Trigger (TRGPER shall be initiated appropriately)

field.name: SLOT_CYCLE
field.description: Maximum Bus Grant Duration for Masters

peripheral.name: PMECC
peripheral.description: Programmable Multibit Error Corrected Code Controller

field.name: PAGESIZE
field.description: Number of Sectors in the Page

enumeratedValue.name: PAGESIZE_1SEC
enumeratedValue.description: 1 sector for main area (512 or 1024 bytes)

enumeratedValue.name: PAGESIZE_2SEC
enumeratedValue.description: 2 sectors for main area (1024 or 2048 bytes)

enumeratedValue.name: PAGESIZE_4SEC
enumeratedValue.description: 4 sectors for main area (2048 or 4096 bytes)

enumeratedValue.name: PAGESIZE_8SEC
enumeratedValue.description: 8 errors for main area (4096 or 8192 bytes)

field.name: STARTADDR
field.description: ECC Area Start Address (byte oriented address)

field.name: ENDADDR
field.description: ECC Area End Address (byte oriented address)

field.name: BUSY
field.description: The Kernel of the PMECC is Busy

field.name: ENINIT
field.description: Initial Number of Bits in the Codeword

field.name: ERRLOCN
field.description: Error Position within the set {sector area, spare area}.

field.name: ACTBST
field.description: ACTIVE Bank X to Burst Stop Read Access Bank Y

field.name: TMRD
field.description: Load Mode Register Command to Active or Refresh Command

field.name: TXSNR

field.name: TXARDS

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is enabled. This bit enables replay mode or contiguous mode when several buffers are transferred.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, source address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the source address and the control register are reloaded from previous transfer.

field.name: SRC_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Source

enumeratedValue.name: SW
enumeratedValue.description: Software handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: HW
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, destination address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the destination and the control register are reloaded from the pre-vious transfer.

field.name: DST_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Destination

enumeratedValue.name: SW
enumeratedValue.description: Software handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: HW
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: STOP ON DONE disabled, the descriptor fetch operation ignores DONE Field of CTRLA register.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: STOP ON DONE activated, the DMAC module is automatically disabled if DONE FIELD is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: AHB Bus Locking capability is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: CHUNK
enumeratedValue.description: The Master Interface Arbiter is locked by the channel x for a chunk transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: The Master Interface Arbiter is locked by the channel x for a buffer transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: ALAP_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: The largest defined length AHB burst is performed on the destination AHB interface.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: When half FIFO size is available/filled, a source/destination request is serviced.

enumeratedValue.name: ASAP_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: When there is enough space/data available to perform a single AHB access, then the request is serviced.

field.name: DST_INCR

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is enabled. This bit enables replay mode or contiguous mode when several buffers are transferred.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, source address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the source address and the control register are reloaded from previous transfer.

field.name: SRC_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Source

enumeratedValue.name: SW

enumeratedValue.name: HW
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, destination address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the destination and the control register are reloaded from the pre-vious transfer.

field.name: DST_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Destination

enumeratedValue.name: SW
enumeratedValue.description: Software handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: HW

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: STOP ON DONE activated, the DMAC module is automatically disabled if DONE FIELD is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: ALAP_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: The largest defined length AHB burst is performed on the destination AHB interface.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: When half FIFO size is available/filled, a source/destination request is serviced.

enumeratedValue.name: ASAP_CFG
enumeratedValue.description: When there is enough space/data available to perform a single AHB access, then the request is serviced.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic multiple buffer transfer is enabled. This bit enables replay mode or contiguous mode when several buffers are transferred.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, source address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the source address and the control register are reloaded from previous transfer.

field.name: SRC_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Source

enumeratedValue.name: HW
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware handshaking interface is used to trigger a transfer request.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTIGUOUS_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, destination address is contiguous between two buffers.

enumeratedValue.name: RELOAD_ADDR
enumeratedValue.description: When automatic mode is activated, the destination and the control register are reloaded from the pre-vious transfer.

field.name: DST_H2SEL
field.description: Software or Hardware Selection for the Destination

enumeratedValue.description: Month change (every 01 of each month at time 00:00:00)

enumeratedValue.name: FREERUN
enumeratedValue.description: Time and calendar registers cannot be updated.

enumeratedValue.name: UPDATE
enumeratedValue.description: Time and calendar registers can be updated.

enumeratedValue.name: ALARMEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: An alarm matching condition has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_SECEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: No second event has occurred since the last clear.

enumeratedValue.name: SECEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: At least one second event has occurred since the last clear.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIMEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: No time event has occurred since the last clear.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: At least one time event has occurred since the last clear.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CALEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: No calendar event has occurred since the last clear.

enumeratedValue.name: CALEVENT
enumeratedValue.description: At least one calendar event has occurred since the last clear.
